newsitem.title: USA: RJR reiterates stance on food unit spinoff.
newsitem.headline: RJR reiterates stance on food unit spinoff.

text.p: RJR Nabisco Holdings Corp reiterated that it sees no spinoff of its food unit prior to 1997.
In response to a question, a spokeswoman said, "The board has stated it would not consider a spinoff prior to 1997."
The spokeswoman also said, "We believe we need to see some resolutions in some of the litigation currently pending against us before we can successfully move ahead with a spinoff."
The spokeswoman said it has also been the board's position for more than a year that there would be no spinoff prior to the end of 1998 "if the resulting entities were not investment grade."

In response to a question, the spokeswoman said there has been brief and informal contact over the telephone recently between investor Carl Icahn and chairman and chief executive Steven Goldstone. Icahn has been pushing for a quicker spinoff.
RJR Nabisco owns about 80 percent of the food unit, which trades publicly as Nabisco Holdings Corp.
